title: Wolf Trap National Park for the Performing Arts: Park Home
body: The only national park dedicated to presenting the performing arts.  No matter what your age or taste in shows, you'll find something you like onstage at Wolf Trap. From May through September, multiple amphitheaters in the park present performances such as musicals, dance, opera, jazz, and popular and country music.A good time to explore the beautyÂ  and history of the park without the crowds is October - April. Read More               Performance And Ticket Information   Find out what shows are coming soon and how to get your ticket.        House Rules and Policies   Learn about the laws and policies that govern Wolf Trap.        Filene Center Inspections   For the safety and security of all, there are inspections and size restrictions in place for the ticketed area.              Filene Center Activities   Prior to performances at the Filene Center, there are opportunities for recreation and relaxation throughout the park.        Children's Theater Activities   There are many activities that are centered around a visit to Theatre-in-the-Woods beyond a performance.        Take A Hike!   Winding through the woods and over Wolf Trap Run to explore the park's natural areas on the Wolf Trap Trail or TRACK Trail.
